author: E-J Dallison
comment: Love the app but discovered out of the blue today that I was on a trial premium subscription and I'm now limited in the number of recipes I can backup unless I pay an annual fee. It's a shame but I'll be looking for another app - one that offers more transparency on what they're offering. Tricking users isn't a great way to create loyalty.

author: Adam Warren
comment: Suggested changes are to have the option to convert between imperial and metric. Also, a timer function would be handy! No doubt more difficult is greater compatibility with more websites to get recipes - The guardian, chef steps, sorted food amongst others would be fantastic

author: E T
comment: The best recipe clipper app on the market.  It blows the competition out of the water in that regard.  Easy and intuitive to use.

author: Ben Robinson
comment: Unable to sync since last update. Please fix.
title: No sync

author: Patti Hopkins
comment: Great way to keep all my favorite  recipies, whether from on line source or from one of my old hard copy recipies.  Also, it is easy to share my recipies on line or by printed copy.  I just love it!

author: Jesse Johnson
comment: I primarily use it to access my Gourmet database on my tablet via Nextcloud sync. Works great, just requires occasional manual database export from Gourmet.

author: Momzy Moo
comment: This is the perfect app for creating and storing your own recipes as well as collecting recipes from the internet.

author: Matthew Dahley
comment: Does exactly what I need. Wish mastercook import would work for me.

author: Chelsea Barrett
comment: Would like the ability to keep inventory on this app to help with meal planning.

author: Philip J Ayton
comment: Great for collecting recipes. Easy to navigate, importing from browser is brilliant.

author: Jono Rose
comment: Very user friendly. Easy to download and add recipes.

author: Cynthia Opfer
comment: Best recipe app!

author: Bev
comment: Love all aspects of it. What a Time saver! Got mine free with Google Opinion Awards. Win, win for me. Did take me a minute to figure  out importing.                                             Barbara Sonnamaker, if no one has mentioned, says in Read More section that Android App holds unlimited recipes.

author: Evelina Mewa
comment: I love the add free version. I  use this app everyday.  I don't care if there are or are not many recipes as some reviews have written about. This app is the best thing ever for clipping recipes off the internet. I use it while watching cooking shows on TV. I also add my own personal recipes. I even add recipes, for my own personal use, by taking a picture of a recipe out of my cookbook.  I love how I can add photos to the recipes, the app allows more than one picture to be added, several, in fact, useful for any new technique in a recipe you are trying to master.  This feature is also  helpful for photographing those old, fading, hand written recipes from your great grandma, grandma, mom. And the best part of the adding photo feature is once you save the recipe with the pictures, you can safely delete the pictures off your device. Plus you can back up all your recipes in multiple formats which are friendly across all my devices, even viewable, in a limited way, on my pc! I don't subscribe to the service that allows me to have access to all my recipes across all my devices because I prefer to have my recipes under my control. If I lose my recipes it is my own fault and no one else's. Therefore I end up backing up frequently and make those back ups available via the cloud or personal server to any device in case of an emergency. Frankly, my back up is huge and I have a dedicated tablet just for this app. I don't want to crowd my phone with it. You can selectively back up only certain recipes for traveling and shopping on your phone. I would gladly pay more for a way to do searches by tags and catagory, but that limit might be of my own making and I have yet to fully understand the search feature. Certain features are not available unless you have a monthly subscription. I can deal with that, because even with that limitation this is simply the best app of its kind out there and well worth more than it's price.

author: Donald Spears
comment: DO NOT BUY PRO... Do not buy the PRO version. What they won't mention is that after time it will revert back to free unless you pay their extortion fees. Poor business practice

author: Rich Winlock
comment: Loved this app at first. Then it's like they do a bait and switch, limiting the functions available. Sucks!

author: Marti Tracy
comment: Love it, love it! So convenient. Pros: It has reg back up to cloud, can use on my tablet and my other phone. I often add from pintrest, so I can organize, sort and find my recipes easier. Cons: Needs to be compatible with more websites.

author: Max Shenfield
comment: Been using MyCookbookPro for a month and a half for frequent home cooking.  The recipe importer Just Works in terms of ingredient accuracy for all the food blogs I frequent.  Adding recipes to a shopping list is easy and saves me at least 20 minutes every few days. This bit of functionality is certainly useful, but almost every other interaction with this app is clunky.  Ingredients and directions are stripped of context. For recipes with multiple parts (a sauce, different glazes), it's impossible to tell how much of an ingredient to add if it is listed multiple times. For example, if the Directions say "add the salt" in three different places, and there are three different amounts of salt listed in Ingredients.  This makes a huge chunk of the app (including the nice Ingredients/Directions horizontal split) unusable for most recipes I cook.  I always end up back at the site I imported the recipe from to figure out correct amounts for each part of the recipe.  Shopping lists reverts back to nothing checked if you leave them. If you accidentally click out in the middle of a trip, or pre check off ingredients you already have from a list you exported from a recipe and try to come back to it later, you start back at nothing checked. Deleting items is the way to go, but it's a tiny button and sort of a PITA to get to the edit menu for a list.  You can easily scale a recipe (super handy) but can't pin the scale. This means for the typical usage of scaling a recipe, adding it to a shopping list, and cooking it at a later time, you have to remember the exact scale you set it for your shopping list, or risk not having enough ingredients.  The Meal Planner view is only available after you create a premium account online. Weird, I thought I was getting the pro version here?  You can't add one of your recipes in the view itself, which is unintuitive and frustrating.  I respect what they've accomplished, but this app leaves a lot to be desired in overall ease of use.

author: Michael Larkin
comment: Worth paying the small fee to remove ads imo. Import from webpages is nice feature, as is keeping tablet from sleep when app is open.

author: Barbara Sonnamaker
comment: Love the app BUT being I paid for the app, it doesn't seem right that I am limited to a small amount of recipes.  What is the point of buying??

author: Ron Dallman
comment: Quick and easy downloads from the web. Syncs with my devices so I can look up recipes.

author: Ben Temple
comment: Wonderful app. Worth the tiny cost per year for the subscription. I can share my recipes with my family.

author: terry dingles
comment: This app does everything that I want and more.

author: Tonya Anton
comment: Now I have to pay a subscription.

author: Linda Burnett
comment: Really good cookbook app. I can even add my own recipes.

author: gilda bazzano
comment: It is a great app , I save so much time using it !

author: Dave Pelcher
comment: Very easy to use.  Has everything you need. Very easy to make it your own book.

author: Duane Wright
comment: Really liked having all my internet recipes in one place

author: Ed Fast
comment: This app is great and does everything I need it for.

author: Donna Woloshansky
comment: Awesome app! I use it on my phone & tablet!

author: Paul Murrant
comment: Fantastic. Great to be able to import recipe from the web

author: Graham Abraham
comment: Great app does everything I need.

author: Linda Matt
comment: Easy to use and  forwarding recipes is very easy

author: Debra Lamar
comment: I've used it for years and I Love it!

author: Cori Van Der Elst
comment: This is truely the BEST EVER COOKBOOK! Easy to use!!!!!!

author: Christian Knight
comment: This is an awesome app. C:

author: Grant
comment: Great app, easy to use

author: Natasha Wright
comment: Easy to use. Love it!

author: Zuheir Totari
comment: Excellent app for home cooks
Great app!
